relation: Categories
Campus Safety
Clubs and Activities
Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
Campus Safety is great here. They are always on call and will come where ever you need them. They will unlock your door if you are locked out and are very nice and caring.
Pops is a wonderful Club here on campus that tries to get student involved and throws together parties and movies nights.
Smc is a great place for athletes. Everyone comes out to games and supports other teams.
They just built this new Cafe under Judd residence hall where there are, on some nights, karaoke contests and such.

Well Spartanburg is a very populated city so there are plenty of things to do. Also, the school is only five minutes from downtown so your never too far from a good time. There are normally baseball and softball games going on on the weekends and occasionally a little game of pick football on the campus lawn.
I never thought I would say this but the food is amazing. College cafeterias are normally gross but SMC really does a good job with variety and quality of the food.
Dorm Life is great. You meet so many people and become close friends with all or your roommates and suite mates. Laundry is free and everyone is real respectful with you clothes and belongings.
SMC is mediocre in class difficulty. I guess it just depends on the courses you are taking and the load of credit hours you have per semester.

Taking and tour is key. The campus is very small but it can be kind of intimidating coming in for your first year in college. So take a tour and get to know the campus really well. Also, if you play a sport talk with the coaches here on campus they will be more than happy to talk to you and help you out with anything you need.

Spartanburg Methodist College is small, two year college which is a great transition college for the high school student. The students and faculty are very helpful and are willing to go above and beyond for you. SMC is a great choice for graduating seniors.
pageTitle: Spartanburg Methodist College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {28747=Criminal Justice Club - Provides activities related to the Criminal Justice System to enhance career development for those interested in the criminal justice field. Delta Psi Omega Theatre Fraternity - The goal of this organization is to encourage and generate interest in theatre on the SMC campus. Delta Psi Omega helps to bring culture, entertainment, and dramatic social oriented venues to the SMC community. Gaming Society - The SMC Gaming Society seeks to provide students with an opportunity to gather with friends and play games of all kinds including but not limited to board games, card games, and video games. Hispanic Student Association - This organization exists to to enlighten non-hispanic students about hispanic culture and bring hispanic students together as well as promote and create activities for hispanic and non-hispanic students that exhibit spanish culture. Student Government Association - Represents the student's point of view in matters effecting SMC Community. And assists in planning social/recreational activities for the student body. Weekly Board Meetings every other Monday @ 11 am in the Gosa Room of the Student Center. All SMC students are invited to attend. P.O.P.S. - People Organizing Programs Successfully - Weekly meetings each Monday @ 4:00 pm in the Fireplace Room of the Student Center. All SMC students are invited to attend. Theta Lambda Nu - An online philosophy and religion society designed to open the lines the of communication between students, faculty, and staff of all religious backgrounds, regardless of belief. Contact Dr. Mark Gibbs to be added to the online facebook group. Campus Ministry Baptist Collegiate Ministry - Supports the student-led worship service, Overflow, on Thursdays at 9 pm in the Chapel; Also hosts several small groups throughout the week and Basketball and Bible Study on Sundays at 11:30 am in the Old Gym. Presbyterian Student Association Wesley Fellowship - Meets on Monday nights @ 5:30 in the SMC Chapel National Honor Societies Sigma Kappa Delta - National Honor Society for English students meeting specified academic requirements. Phi Theta Kappa - National Honor Society for Junior colleges. Membership is open to students with a 3.5 cumulative GPA and a minimum of 16 credit hours earned. Psi Beta - The National Honor Society for students in the field of Psychology in the two year college. They must have completed a B or higher in all Psychology Classes and have maintained a 3.0 GPA overall. Service Fraternity Kappa Sigma Alpha - Co-ed service fraternity serving the campus and local community through various projects throughout the year. Publications Trailblazer - Campus Newspaper published several times each semester. Offers opportunity to develop research, interviewing, writing, and editing skills. All students welcome. Illusions - College literary magazine produced each spring; open to all students interested in creative writing and visual arts. Olympian - Yearbook staff, open to all students, which presents the SMC annual each spring. Musical/Theatre Gospel Choir - Open to all students who enjoy singing and fellowship. Performs at chapel services and various on and off campus events. Practice on Mondays and Wednesdays at 7 pm in the Chapel SMC Glee - An auditioned singing and dancing group that performs at basketball games, campus events, and throughout the community. SMC Singers - Open to all students, the SMC singers perform at SMC Chapel Services and Fine Arts Recitals. SMC Troubadours - Students selected by audition, this choral ensemble performs at special functions, including the Fall and Spring SMC Concerts. The group also performs on a touring series each year primarily at local churches and schools SMC Players - A Student Drama organization presenting two productions each year., 77055=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 34684=JOIN A CLUB Criminal Justice Club - Provides activities related to the Criminal Justice System to enhance career development for those interested in the criminal justice field. textAfterTable: What to do for fun play soccer, join clubs, and school activities. Food and Dining its ok.. you get use to it. Dorm Life looooovvve it! Academic Rigor they are very good educators. they are challenging and helpful. Tips for prospective students be prepared.prompt. just enjoy and study study study. In three sentences they are a well organized school. very small so there is a lot more one-on-one attention. everyone is very friendly and fun!
